unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Uptick in Data Plan Consumption Driven by OTT Growth**
normalised: telecom sector sees uptick in data plan consumption driven by O T T growth

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – Indian telecom operators are reporting a significant surge in data plan consumption, primarily fueled by the increasing popularity of Over-The-Top (OTT) streaming services. Preliminary Q3 figures indicate an average data usage of 20 GB per month per subscriber, a 15% increase compared to the previous quarter.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – indian telecom operators are reporting a significant surge in data plan consumption, primarily fueled by the increasing popularity of over-the-top (O T T) streaming services. preliminary Q three figures indicate an average data usage of twenty gigabyte per month per subscriber, a fifteen percent increase compared to the previous quarter.

unnormalised: The Reliance Jio Institute, in a recent report, attributes this growth to affordable data plans and the widespread adoption of smartphones in Tier II and Tier III cities. The report also highlights the impact of Bollywood content, citing "Pathaan" as a key driver of video streaming traffic in January and February. Airtel and Vodafone Idea are now rolling out revised data plans offering more data at competitive rates, starting from Rs. 299 for 1.5 GB/day. Experts predict that the demand for high-speed data will continue to grow, with the rollout of 5G networks further accelerating this trend in the coming months. Consumers in areas like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar are showing particularly high demand. Analysts expect further competition in the telecom sector as a result.
